glsa.title: Clam AntiVirus: Integer overflows
glsa.synopsis: Clam AntiVirus is vulnerable to integer overflows when handling several file formats, potentially resulting in the execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: Clam AntiVirus is a GPL anti-virus toolkit, designed for integration with mail servers to perform attachment scanning. Clam AntiVirus also provides a command line scanner and a tool for fetching updates of the virus database.

description.p: Neel Mehta and Alex Wheeler discovered that Clam AntiVirus is vulnerable to integer overflows when handling the TNEF, CHM and FSG file formats.

impact.p: By sending a specially-crafted file an attacker could execute arbitrary code with the permissions of the user running Clam AntiVirus.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
